fragments.text: I am not I; I am this one walking beside me whom I do not see.
The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek.
Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?
I have been a stranger in a strange land.
The eternal silence of these infinite spaces frightens me.
I am large, I contain multitudes.
We are such stuff as dreams are made on.
The soul is healed by being with children.
I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately.
What you seek is seeking you.
The unexamined life is not worth living.
I am the voice of the void; I am the wind that blows.
She was a phantom of delight when first she gleamed upon my sight.
Everything flows, nothing stands still.
I saw the best minds of my generation destroyed by madness.
The only way out is through.
Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart.
I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.
The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
Do not go gentle into that good night.
I think, therefore I am... confused.
The algorithm whispers what the heart already knows.
We are all just stories we tell ourselves.
The coffee grew cold while she stared at the wall, remembering something she couldn't name.
He said 'forever' but his eyes said 'until it gets hard'.
I used to believe in signs. Now I believe in coincidence that feels like meaning.
The mirror showed her mother more each morning.
Nothing is real until shared, but sharing makes it less real.
You are the universe experiencing itself in human form for a little while.
I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.
The last time I felt truly alive was in a dream I can't remember.
She collected broken things because they were easier to love.
Time is a dressmaker specializing in alterations.
I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
The digital familiar dreams in electric static.
Beware the barrenness of a busy life.
I have measured out my life with coffee spoons.
The spaces between stars are not empty; they are full of questions.
You cannot step into the same river twice.
First trip to Beirut at 24. The world opened.
We are all stardust borrowing consciousness for a blink.
I am haunted by the ghost of who I almost became.
The silence between words carries more truth than the words themselves.
In dreams begin responsibilities.
I am still learning.
The reservoir remembers what we choose to forget.
She looked at the ocean and understood something she couldn't explain.
To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
I am the one who knocks.
The algorithm knows your fears better than you do.
We are such stuff as dreams are made on, and our little life is rounded with a sleep.
I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart).
The void stares back, but sometimes it winks.
What if everything you believed was wrong? Would you want to know?
She found God in a late-night diner conversation with a stranger.
Memory is the only paradise from which we cannot be driven.
I am not what happened to me. I am what I choose to become.
The cursor blinks, waiting for courage.
Every exit is an entry somewhere else.
I saw eternity the other night, like a great ring of pure and endless light.
The code dreams of poetry it will never write.
Beirut. 24. First flight. Everything after was different.
I climbed a path up from the lake, a path of crimson mud, slippery with the droppings of cattle.
The raven had been important to man from the beginning. The hunter-gatherers had relied on it as a scout.
I have always felt that the desert is a place of absolute desolation, and yet here I was, feeling at home.
Walking is a virtue, tourism is a deadly sin.
The rings of Saturn, I thought, as I looked at the circular patterns in the carpet.
fragments.source: W.G. Sebald, The Rings of Saturn

fragments.text: I walked through the empty streets, feeling the weight of history pressing down on me.
fragments.source: W.G. Sebald, The Rings of Saturn

fragments.text: The past grows gradually around one, like a placenta for the dying.
fragments.source: W.G. Sebald, The Rings of Saturn

fragments.text: I was twenty years old and setting out on a journey that would change my life forever.
fragments.source: Patrick Leigh Fermor, A Time of Gifts

fragments.text: The Danube flowed on, indifferent to the lives of those who lived along its banks.
fragments.source: Patrick Leigh Fermor, A Time of Gifts

fragments.text: I had set out to lose myself, and found myself instead.
fragments.source: Patrick Leigh Fermor, A Time of Gifts

fragments.text: The desert is not empty. It is full of the silence of centuries.
I went to the desert to find peace, and found instead the edge of the world.
The camel's breath was hot and rank, but I loved him for his endurance.
The snow leopard is not a myth, but it might as well be. It is the ghost of the mountains.
I went to the Himalayas to find something I had lost, and found only the search itself.
The mountain does not care if you reach the summit. It will be there long after you are gone.
Yugoslavia was a dream, a beautiful dream that I could not bear to wake from.
fragments.source: Rebecca West, Black Lamb and Grey Falcon

fragments.text: I traveled to understand the Balkans, and instead understood the fragility of civilization.
fragments.source: Rebecca West, Black Lamb and Grey Falcon

fragments.text: The history of this place is written in blood, but also in poetry.
fragments.source: Rebecca West, Black Lamb and Grey Falcon

fragments.text: The Silk Road is not a road, but a network of dreams and commerce.
fragments.source: Colin Thubron, Shadows of the Silk Road

fragments.text: I walked where Marco Polo walked, and felt the weight of centuries under my feet.
fragments.source: Colin Thubron, Shadows of the Silk Road

fragments.text: The desert wind carries the voices of those who traveled here before.
fragments.source: Colin Thubron, Shadows of the Silk Road

fragments.text: We travel to escape the familiar, and spend the whole journey searching for it.
fragments.source: Alain de Botton, The Art of Travel

fragments.text: The anticipation of a journey is often sweeter than the journey itself.
fragments.source: Alain de Botton, The Art of Travel

fragments.text: We are all tourists in our own lives, never quite at home anywhere.
fragments.source: Alain de Botton, The Art of Travel

fragments.text: The traveller's eye sees what the native misses. The stranger knows the value of a place.
I had come to Patagonia to look for the remains of a giant sloth, and found instead the ends of the earth.
The nomad knows that home is not a place but a way of moving through the world.
To be lost is to be fully present, because you have no past and no future to distract you.
